intro: Trigonostemon reidioides, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green foliage and clusters of showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with a distinctive three-lobed calyx that gives the plant its genus name. Trigonostemon reidioides is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated as a houseplant.
